title: Europeans stick by Ukraine, despite mounting challenges.
description: Inflation and anxiety over nuclear weapons may be eating into some popular support for the war, but key governments remain insulated from the pressures for now.

title: Ukraine’s New Air Defense System Comes With a Deep Supply of Ammunition
description: The two NASAMS launchers delivered to Kyiv fire common air-to-air missiles used by its allies.

title: Aerial War Over Ukraine Heats Up as Russia Pounds Cities
description: Ukraine, beefing up its air defenses, says Russia has bought ballistic missiles from Iran to replace the precision weapons it is firing at services vital to civilians.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: The U.S. Votes
description: Plus Europe makes climate pledges and Kenya discloses details of a Chinese railroad contract.

title: Zelensky Tells Climate Meeting Russia’s War Undercuts Needed Action
description: Reports from the ground and research on previous armed conflicts suggest that the ecological impact of the conflict could be enormous.

title: After Decades of Resistance, Rich Countries Offer Direct Climate Aid
description: Several European leaders at COP27 announced funds to help poor nations recover from loss and damage caused by climate change. The United States was silent.

title: French Cardinal’s Admission Renews Scrutiny of Church Sexual Abuse
description: A former archbishop of Bordeaux acknowledged that he had behaved “reprehensibly” with a 14-year-old girl over three decades ago, in the latest revelation to jolt Roman Catholics in France.

title: Setting a Kahlo Drawing Aflame in Search of an NFT Spark
description: It’s tough to profit in the struggling market of blockchain assets right now. Burning a purported drawing from Frida Kahlo’s personal diary didn’t help a businessman’s cause.

title: Draft Report Offers Starkest View Yet of U.S. Climate Threats
description: “The things Americans value most are at risk,” says a draft of the National Climate Assessment, a major federal scientific report slated for release next year.

title: Can South Africa Transition to Clean Energy?
description: A township’s battle over a new mine shows the challenge of a nation dependent on coal, but also desperate to leave it behind.

title: The World’s Democracies Ask: Why Can’t America Fix Itself?
description: Conversations across continents reveal alarm over the United States’ direction, as it slides away from ideals it once pressed other nations to adopt.

title: Your Election Day Guide
description: How to make sense of the results.

title: African Countries Say Richer Nations Are Falling Short on Climate Pledges
description: Leaders from several African nations said their countries could not afford the costs of adapting to climate change and dealing with the natural disasters it fuels.

title: Russia Plays Down Reports of Devastating Losses
description: A rare statement from Russia suggests the Kremlin might be taking more active steps to limit public discontent over the state of the war.

title: Team Melli Once United Iran at World Cup. Now It Reflects Its Divisions.
description: Team Melli was long seen as a unifying force in a fractious nation. As it heads to the World Cup, it has become ensnared in its country’s internal politics.

title: The I
Kenya Discloses Part of Secret Railway Contract With China
description: The public disclosure of a 2014 loan agreement for a cross-country train fulfilled a campaign vow by President William Ruto and revealed China’s tough terms.

title: Rotted Vegetables and Rancid Milk No More, as a Bridge Replaces Ferries
description: Truck drivers used to wait for days before crossing the Gambia River by ferry, but a towering bridge has cut the transit time down to minutes, and brought Senegal and Gambia closer.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
As Ukraine Bears Down, Life Worsens in Occupied Areas
description: Those fleeing speak of the growing dangers of bombardment and of Russian forces commandeering homes and sheltering among civilians.
